data.title: I never eat at TGI Friday
data.text: I am very proud of the fact that no one from my family eats at TGI Friday for over 10 years.  After they started changing their menu and charging ridiculous prices fro very small and terrible meals, we stopped going there and will NEVER go there again.

data.title: TGI FRIDAYS
data.text: This is another we'll run franchise.  We had appetizers and main dishes that we're all hot and delicious. The server was efficient and the prices were moderate

data.title: Got sick
data.text: My husband and me and our daughter had the endless appetizers . And my husband can eat anything and not get sick at all . Well we all got sick after eating here don't know what happened but that one time has turned me away from it .

data.title: Miso chicken very good
data.text: Food was hot, spinach not overcooked, very tasty skillet dish. Parmesan Chicken with broccoli, tomatoe-mozzarella salad was another favorite done right. Not very busy, ate in bar area. Servers were attentive, we like to go there a few times a month.

data.title: Nice variety of good eats!
data.text: We always enjoy eating at T.G.I. Fridays. The staff is friendly and the food is good. The booths are nice and large for a family dinner and the you have food selections to satisfy every taste. I love the location as we can walk through some local shops in the plaza after our meal.

data.title: Awesome ❤
data.text:
After 2 weeks vacations in Florida this was The best food and THE BEST SERVICE👍 
Thank you! 
17.2.2016

data.title: FUN TIME AND VERY VARIED MENUE
data.text:
The restaurant has good food with a varied menu. Everything from steaks to salads. We started off with an appetizer of pop stickers and tasty onion soup. We than had a 
hamburger with all the toppings. They also have a full bar with very reasonable prices.
Overall experience was very enjoyable and will go back.

data.title: Yup still disgusting food
data.text:
Lunch hour and place in nearly empty should have been my first clue. There is an Oder of musty in the air for this sensitive nose should have been 2nd clue. However my little kid was starving. It took nearly 10 minutes to have anyone come over and yet no water was brought. Ordered kids meal hamburger fries etc. burger sliders came and the buns were nasty stale and burgers were so small and beyond overdone. My appetizer of spinach dip was not very warm and my drink ale old Palmer made poorly. Waitress was pleasant. 
Will never ever go back. Don't know how they stay in business so many better choices.

data.title: Nice food  pleasant servers
data.text: Been here several times always have ribs, consistently good,pleasant servers always seem polite and helpful

data.title: It was Friday, but not TGI Friday
data.text:
Everything was as expected, and the waitstaff was great.  Just not as delicious as i remember it being.  Although the chicken was sizzling, it seemed like it was either a formed patty or not grilled completely. Yes, I ate it, so shame on me if I die from raw chicken.  ;)

Just a typical chain restaurant that wasn't very crowded on a Friday night.

data.title: Salad Night
data.text: We had a 2 For 1 coupon for Fridays and decided to go to the Boynton Beach location for 2 salad entrees. The restaurant was very quiet and almost empty even though it was dinner hour. Most of the Fridays I have visited in the past would have been quite active at this time, but not this unit. The salads were fine, but my usual criticism of Fridays is that it is not a good value for your money. Granted the salad was fine, but you get absolutely nothing else with this entree. Many restaurants at least present their diners with some bread to begin their meals, but not Fridays. I am convinced this lack of value is the main reason Fridays is no longer a " hot spot".

data.title: great service poor food
data.text: we stopped by friday's on june 28th 2015 and was disappointed in the food.the service was great although food was slow coming from the kitchen. i ordered med well and was was way over cooked,the coleslaw was the worst i had ever had. my family liked the starters we got but said their meals wwas just ok. i doubt we will go back,for the $80 plus we spent the we could have ate much better elsewhere,

data.title: Do not waste your money....
data.text: The service is always bad and the food is so expensive! They never cook your food right and expect you to pay for their mistakes. We will NEVER go back there!

data.title: High expectations, horrible return
data.text: I asked before I ordered the steak if the chef does good steaks.  I was assured that he did.  I also ordered my broccoli soft.  I ordered medium well steak and it came out medium rare.  My knife wouldn't even cut through the broccoli so it definitely wasn't soft.  I spoke with the manager and had my meal comped, but I was really disappointed that I couldn't get a good meal that I wanted so bad.

data.title: Nothing special...
data.text: I have been to a few TGI's in different States,and some are above average and some below. This one is below. The food is good,but the floors were sticky and the wait staff were just okay. Nothing special..

data.title: Always love Fridays
data.text: The food is always consistent at the chain restaurants.We went here twice on vacation. Both times had upbeat servers. Drinks are half price. Chips and salsa are free if you have their club card. Food very good.

data.title: Great Restaurant
data.text: I love TGI Friday's period.  But this one in Boynton Beach is just fabulous.  The staff is very friendly, no long waits for your food, food is cooked the way you asked for, staff has plenty of suggestions if you don't know what to have, they all go above and beyond.  The management is great!  They truly make sure everything is the way you want it.  Never had a problem at this restaurant.  I go monthly.

data.title: Thursday at Friday's
data.text:
We went to dinner and the place was hopping.  At first was a little worried that would result in delays but even with our party of 6 it was the best service ever. 
Drinks were kept full and our waiter was the best.  He was friendly,  helpful with suggestions and substitutes. The Manager checked on us several times and was very friendly. He made our night and I would definitely come back to this location again. The food was fresh hot and everything was wonderful.

data.title: Boring
data.text: This place is a clone of all the Duffys and Ale Houses nearby. When going out, it's rare that any of these joints come to mind.

owner_response.author: Trey C, Marketing at TGI Friday's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We apologize about your experience at our restaurant.  I will be reaching out to you personally to learn more about your dining experience and to see if we can make it up to you.

I will tell you Fridays has been around since 1965 so if anything Duffy's and the Ale House are a clone of us. 

Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: General manager has no leadership skills.
data.text: Came for lunch and drinks on a very slow Saturday afternoon. Maybe 3 tables in the restuarant. Had a veteran server, this we knew because the couple we joined for lunch eats here religiously. Drinks 20 minutes food another 30 minutes. The potato skins still frozen with frozen cheese on top. I don't know how you can possibly mess something up that only needs to be heated up with a lot of time to do it. General manager cane out to the table and pretty much laughed in our faces. He claims he was the one cooking in the kitchen. Ok now it all makes sense. Most of the food that was ordered was sent back because it was either frozen or not what we had ordered. It would have been nice if between the server or the manager things got corrected but never hapoened. This restuarant is in a prime location and would probably be a lot busier but it will never happen with people running it that just don't care.
